result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony R. Lowe Jr.

records.addlTxt: Scheduling conference on November 30, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Scheduling conference on September 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Scheduling conference on August 3, 2022 at 09:30 am.

1:47 PM Defendant Anthony R. LOWE Jr. appeared by video in custody.  Attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Michael Ross Blum appeared by video for Anthony R. LOWE Jr.  Inducement made.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over for further proceedings.  Arraignment held. Defendant waives the reading of the Information. Not guilty plea entered to the charge(s) contained in the Information. Defendant waives right to substitution.  States offer to be given to defense/defendant by July 8, 2022.   

BAIL MODIFICATION:  Defense argues for a conversion of cash bond to a reduction or signature bond.  Court reviews the current bail situation in Mr. Lowe's cases and his behavior while out on bond, resulting in non-appearances.  State makes the standard argument for denial.  Court finds that these cases scheduled today are not the reason Mr. Lowe is currently in jail and suggests redirecting the request to Branch 1 where Defendant is currently sitting on cash bail.  
Scheduling conference scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 09:30 am.

2:29 pm - Prosecuting attorney Gail Ann Prost in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Anthony R. Lowe Jr. appeared by video, in custody, at Manitowoc County Jail.  Attorney Michael Ross Blum appeared by video for Anthony R. Lowe Jr. Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on May 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Attorney Michael Blum is appointed as counsel of record.  Defendant is to reimburse the county pursuant to standard collection practices of the Manitowoc County Clerk of Court.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

3:07 pm - Prosecuting attorney Gail Ann Prost appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Anthony Lowe, Jr. did not appear in court. State requests warrant and forfeiture of bail.  Court authorizes warrant and forfeiture of bail.  No voluntary appearance allowed.

ADDRESS INFO for Anthony R. Lowe Jr.
Current: 2025 S. 21st StreetA  #, Manitowoc, WI 54220   (Effective: 01-27-2022)
Prior: 2520 S 21St St, Manitowoc, WI 54220
RE: Felony bail jumping, on 12-30-21.

$500.00 cash bail furnished and defendant released from custody.
Notice to Party Furnishing Cash Bail.
 - Gabrielle Gonion @ 2000 Johnston Drive, Manitowoc, WI 54220
Order for Prints.
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of 5 counts felony bail jumping, misdemeanor bail jumping and resist officer.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 01-31-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 1.  Bail is set at $500.00 cash.    Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.  Court orders photos and prints at MTPD.
Minutes.
